data.title: Great neighborhood bar
data.text: Visiting from North California. My friend lives 0.40 miles from this bar. Great bartenders, drinks, food, karaoke Friday. Must try in Redmond area.

data.title: Owner is rude and disrespectful
data.text: We used to frequent this place to enjoy a beer and conversation.  That changed the day we met the owner, he was rude and treated us poorly.  There may be other loyal customers who have a different opinion and that is fine but we'll never take our business back there again.

data.title: Pre funkin at Palmers
data.text: Came here before a concert at Marymoor, had a few beers. Craig the bartender was so amazing and friendly! We had such a good time we came back here again after the concert! The place was packed on a Saturday and had the best huge jello shooters! lol! Met some excellent people and had a great time. I'm from Vancouver BC and wouldn't really classify it as a Dive bar in Canadian terms, (I've been in some REAL dive bars at home!) but I found it quite comfortable and very friendly. Can't wait to go back one day!

data.title: dive bar with karaoke!
data.text: Tiny little dive bar in the middle of downtown Redmond. Drinks and food is cheap. They have a pretty good menu for a dive bar. In addition to the regular fried bar food, they also have a good selection of burgers. I got the blue cheese burger and it was delicious! And no I wasn't drunk at this point. We also ordered the calamari and jalapeno poppers. The jalapeno poppers were the kind with cream cheese, which is the kind that I like. The calamari was a pretty basic calamari. Even though we got a bunch of fried food, it was good, it wasn't drenched in oil like a lot of fried food is. We were there for a going away party and the place was packed out "our party" The place is pretty small but they also have a little room in the back with a pool table. A lot of locals come here too! Fun little place with karaoke. Karaoke and drunk people is always fun to watch :) If you're looking for some bar food in the Redmond area, this place is good. There's a small parking lot across the street that they share with another restaurant but not much parking there. Most likely you'll have to look for some street parking.

data.title: great local dive
data.text: Great lunch specials on drinks and food. Surprisingly good food for the look and feel. Lots of drink choices but can get a bit redneck and colorful in language.

data.title: Hilarious!
data.text:
This is one of my favorite dive bars ever.  I've played a lot of show and sung a lot of karaoke in some real dicey places and while this is definitely dicey,  you can't beat the prices and the people watching is THE BEST!  From aging grunge kids to 20-something frat-boys getting denied by every girl in the bar,  the crap-fest only ends when you leave! 

$6 bucks for a Grey Goose is hilariously affordable to me after being in LA for so long (and having to spend $10-$12 for the same drink.) the bar food is...  Bar food,  so it's exactly what your drunken self needs at 12:45 and you can't tell if the person next to you is giving you eyes or is about to pass out!

Come,  watch the show and try the veal!

data.title: stink-palm-er
data.text:
This bar is basically  what you dream of when you're searching for a hole-in-the-wall bar with plenty of drunk locals.  Our favorite type of bar!! We had a cheap pitcher of beer, and were propositioned by an elderly gentleman.  

If you're looking for class, go elsewhere. If you're lookiing for weird, smoke-covered, grimy dudes with teeth missing, this is your place!

data.title: interesting clientele and convenient location
data.text:
your typical dive bar that sticks out like a random sore thumb on the eastside. been here a few times and listened to people sing horrible songs during karaoke.  people that come here are friendly and make conversation easy with strangers but there are some strange folks as well that fall into the mix.

last night i witnessed a lady bull riding her date (get a room), talked to a man who pulled up a photo of his 27 year old daughter and proceed to tell me how amazing and beautiful she was, creepy.

bartender and dj are fun to be around and drinks are good. overall, convenient location to hit up after dinner at matador. not many places in downtown redmond (outside of Redmond Town Center) that you can just chill and pop in and have a drink that is as laid back as this place.

data.title: Good food + cheap beer + hole-in-the-wall atmosphere = my kind of place.  The $10 prime rib dinner on Friday night is a...
data.text: Good food + cheap beer + hole-in-the-wall atmosphere = my kind of place.  The $10 prime rib dinner on Friday night is a great deal.
